sub_title: Cybersecurity Expert with a Strong Technical Background: Pentestingüìê | MSSP Advisoryüí™ | CISO‚ò¢Ô∏è | Kali Linuxüñ•Ô∏è | Malware Researchü¶† | Vatican CyberVolunteer‚ò© | Machine Learning & A.I.ü§ñ | NIS2
summary:
- Background in engineering, consulting, and research
- Experience with leading companies, such as Verizon and Accenture
- Specializes in operational cybersecurity for large organizations
- Passionate about mentoring and training the next generation of cybersecurity specialists
- Utilizes industry standards like ISO, NIST, and CIS Controls for best practices
- Expert in McAfee DLP, PGP and other vendor products

**Accolades:**
- Named one of the 50 most talented young leaders in the Netherlands by MT Magazine
- Received the Goudhaantje Award in 2019

**Activities:**
- Actively participates in OSINT tasks for continuous learning and professional growth

**Geography:** Benelux, Middle-East & Nordics (Belgium, Netherlands, Luxembourg, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Egypt, Monaco, Vatican City)

**GitHub Portfolio:** [https://github.com/joe-shenouda/](https://github.com/joe-shenouda/)

You will be able to work in industrial ICS environments where you will develop a Cyber Security Management Plan.

The ISA/IEC 62443 Cybersecurity Fundamentals Specialist certificate program is designed for professionals involved in IT and control system security roles that need to develop a command of industrial cybersecurity terminology and understanding of the material embedded in the ISA99 standards.

I deliver the training in The Netherlands and globally in-house at your company in several languages.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Member Advisory Board for C|HFI ( Computer Hacking Forensic Investigator)', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'EC-Council', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHPon7g_XjJpA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519901653038?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=e6n01j63gt1ObEqpJE0bt_6dQSwe5R7GMurtEPRZK1M', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ec-council/'}, 'cause': 'SCIENCE_AND_TECHNOLOGY', 'description': 'The EC-Council Advisory Board for C|HFI ( Computer Hacking Forensic Investigator) is comprised of prominent Global leaders and World-class Cyber Forensic professionals from diverse sectors and well-known brands. Their voices serve as an invaluable guidance to help EC-Council in building new initiatives for Cyber and Digital Forensics.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Board Member Helmond', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'D66', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQG9HLjlSonFew/company-logo_400_400/0/1684389358430?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=0twMae4QnCKyDlnJ2nOf4SZRRQShUFkjdoaLoDXAuJg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/d66-dutch-democratic-party/'}, 'cause': 'POLITICS', 'description': None}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Founder', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Vatican CyberVolunteers', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQGkbTXFS7Lknw/company-logo_400_400/0/1642612756732?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=J0aDnX_naBaj1Hckf4TWUDOGPD6ULWnQNRliUucgDnc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/vatican-cybervolunteers/'}, 'cause': 'SCIENCE_AND_TECHNOLOGY', 'description': "We are a group of talented cybersecurity professionals from all over the world who work daily in companies and organizations in the field of cybersecurity. We dedicate our time and efforts to help bolster and secure the Vatican Cyber defenses by offering free consultancy, hands-on services and cloud services for free or against cost-price.

Vatican City has a sprawling system of websites administered by the Internet Office of the Holy See and organized under the country code top-level domain ‚Äú.va‚Äù. The Vatican‚Äôs web presence has expanded steadily since its launched its main website, www.vatican.va, in 1995. ( List of websites: http://www.vatican.va/siti_va/index_va_en.htm ) 

Hackers have frequently targeted the Vatican since it first went online. In 2012, the hacking group Anonymous briefly blocked access to www.vatican.va and disabled other sites, including those of the Vatican secretariat of state and the Vatican newspaper L‚ÄôOsservatore Romano.

A British cyber security consultancy approached the Vatican following reports in July 2020 that suspected Chinese state-sponsored hackers had targeted Vatican computer networks. 

The need to secure, like any organization in the world, is very clear in the Vatican, and we like to help.

We're currently recruiting!"}]
